meanings.def: the female ruler of an independent state that has a royal family
examples: She was crowned queen at the age of fifteen.
queen of… the Queen of Norway
She became queen after the sudden death of her brother.
The banquet will be hosted by the Queen at Buckingham Palace.
Henry VII and his queen, Elizabeth of York
queen of… The King and Queen of Denmark attended the wedding.

meanings.def: a woman, place or thing that is thought to be one of the best in a particular group or area
a woman or girl chosen to perform official duties at a festival or celebration
examples: a May queen (= at a festival to celebrate the coming of spring)
She was nominated for prom queen in high school.

meanings.def: the most powerful piece used in the game of chess that can move any number of squares in any direction
a playing card with the picture of a queen on it
a large female insect that lays eggs for the whole group
an offensive word for a gay man who behaves like a woman
the person considered to be the best, most famous or successful in a particular place or area of activity

idioms.def: the person considered to be the best, most famous or successful in a particular place or area of activity

meanings.def: a successful British pop group formed in 1971. Its singer was Freddie Mercury and its albums A Night at the Opera (1975), The Game (1980) and Innuendo (1991) as well as the song Bohemian Rhapsody (1975) were all No. 1 in Britain. The 2002 musical We Will Rock You is based on the group's music.
